post.description:
Use this endpoint to initiate the subscription process.

Response of this endpoint `sessionId` has to be passed to the
[Yoursafe Flowguard SDK](https://flowguard.yoursafe.com/js/docs/index.html) to start the payment process.

This endpoint is secured by JWTs. You can find more information how to work with JWTs in the
[Security section](#section/Security).

### JWT Payload

JWT payload has to contain the following fields:

| Field            | Field type       | Note                                                           |
|:-----------------|:-----------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------|
| shopId           | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter.                                    |
| priceAmount      | string           | In format NNN.NN                                               |
| priceCurrency    | string           | One of: USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, NOK, SEK         |
| successUrl       | string           | Max length 255 characters.                                     |
| declineUrl       | string           | Max length 255 characters.                                     |
| postbackUrl      | string           | Max length 255 characters.                                     |
| email            | string           | Max length 100 characters.                                     |
| subscriptionType | string           | One of: recurring, one-time |
| period           | string           | In ISO 8601 period format (e.g. P30D, P1M, P1Y)                |
| referenceId      | string or null   | Optional. Max length 100 characters.                           |
| trialAmount      | string or null   | Optional. In format NNN.NN                                     |
| trialPeriod      | string or null   | Optional. In ISO 8601 period format (e.g. P30D, P1M, P1Y)      |

### Period format
Period consists of 3 parts (P, number, unit). Units can be: D - day, M - month, Y - year.
For example:
- P30D - 30 days
- P1M - 1 month
- P1Y - 1 year

#### Minimum and maximum period restrictions
- for one-time subscription minimum period length is 2 days, maximum period length is 180 days
- for recurring subscription minimum period length is 7 days, maximum period length is 180 days
- maximum period can be prolonged up to 730 days if merchant has long subscriptions enabled

#### Minimum and maximum trialPeriod restrictions
- minimum trialPeriod length is 2 days, maximum trialPeriod length is 180 days
- maximum trialPeriod can be prolonged up to 730 days if merchant has long subscriptions enabled

### JWT Example

<style>
  pre {
    white-space: pre-wrap !important;
  }
  pre > code {
    color: rgb(160, 251, 170) !important;
  }
</style>


```
eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..EwpofyMOWGqqmk4RQU7DgQHWCxl32GQLckrNOnHBSy4
```

This endpoint is used to cancel a subscription. 

This endpoint is secured by JWTs. You can find more information how to work with JWTs in the
[Security section](#section/Security).

### JWT Payload

JWT payload has to contain the following fields:

| Field       | Field type       | Note                                                                        |
|:------------|:-----------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| saleId      | number or string | Sale ID of subscription to cancel.                                          |
| shopId      | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter.                                                 |
| cancelledBy | string           | Optional, one of: merchant, buyer |

### JWT Example

<style>
  pre {
    white-space: pre-wrap !important;
  }
  pre > code {
    color: rgb(160, 251, 170) !important;
  }
</style>


```
eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzaG9wSWQiOiI2NTE1MSIsInNhbGVJZCI6IjIwODAiLCJjYW5jZWxsZWRCeSI6Im1lcmNoYW50In0.gAbebyxDsecJrriAosWvtdi-SG_dt6MTVMC6NmOGriE
```

Use this endpoint to initiate the order process for a single purchase. 

Response of this endpoint `sessionId` has to be passed to the
 [Yoursafe Flowguard SDK](https://flowguard.yoursafe.com/js/docs/index.html) to start the payment process. 

This endpoint is secured by JWTs. You can find more information how to work with JWTs in the
[Security section](#section/Security).

### JWT Payload

JWT payload has to contain the following fields:

| Field         | Field type       | Note                                                   |
|:--------------|:-----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------|
| shopId        | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter.                            |
| priceAmount   | string           | In format NNN.NN                                       |
| priceCurrency | string           | One of: USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, NOK, SEK |
| successUrl    | string           | Max length 255 characters.                             |
| declineUrl    | string           | Max length 255 characters.                             |
| postbackUrl   | string           | Max length 255 characters.                             |
| email         | string           | Max length 100 characters.                             |
| referenceId   | string or null   | Optional. Max length 100 characters.                   |

### JWT Example

<style>
  pre {
    white-space: pre-wrap !important;
  }
  pre > code {
    color: rgb(160, 251, 170) !important;
  }
</style>


```
eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..J8LY9lYSI9HWAiZPjXKLZ7dXIMno9CBIRt5fk9M5gOM
```

tags.name: Overview
tags.description:
# Yoursafe Flowguard

Yoursafe Flowguard is a cutting-edge payment integration solution designed for Verotel, CardBilling,
and Gaycharge. It provides an improved, modern alternative to redirect-based models, like FlexPay,
by allowing you to embed secure payment iframes directly into your order pages. This streamlines
the buyer's experience, removes redirects, thereby improving conversion rates without compromising
data security or PCI compliance.

## Key Benefits

- **No Redirects**: Flowguard boosts conversions by keeping buyers on your website without the need
for redirects
- **Fully PCI-DSS Compliant**: By using iframe components, Flowguard allows you to avoid handling
card-data. This significantly limits your PCI-DSS exposure
- **Highly Customizable**: The components are fully customizable, allowing you to create a fully
branded, seamless checkout experience
- **Reduced Fraud & Chargebacks**: As you are used to with our other integration methods, Flowguard
provides you with 3DS Support and strong fraud controls

## Core Components

Flowguard provides two main tools for integration: the Flowguard SDK and the Flowguard API. These
tools ensure that sensitive card data remains isolated from the merchant while offering a seamless
and fully customizable user experience.

### Flowguard SDK

This is the JavaScript-based toolkit that enables embedding iframes securely. The iframes are hosted
on flowguard.yoursafe.com, and remain isolated from your servers. It allows you to customize the
look and feel of the components to seamlessly integrate with your own page design.
See the [Flowguard SDK docs](https://flowguard.yoursafe.com/js/docs/index.html) for more info.

### Flowguard API

This API allows you to initiate purchases and manage subscriptions. Transactions are processed in
the background. It also enables postback integrations, which provides you with any and all status updates.

## Need help?

For any questions or technical issues, feel free to contact our support team at
merchantsupport@verotel.com. We're here to assist you!

tags.name: Getting started
tags.description: Welcome to the Yoursafe Flowguard API documentation. Yoursafe Flowguard is designed to seamlessly integrate secure payment processing with full control, offering unparalleled control over your payment flow while ensuring top-tier security and compliance. ## Yoursafe Flowguard overview Following overview provides a high-level understanding of how Yoursafe Flowguard works. ## Security All Yoursafe Flowguard API endpoints are secured with JWTs (Json Web Tokens), which ensures security of your data. JWT has to consist of three parts: header, payload, and signature. We recommend [JWT Debugger](https://jwt.io/#debugger-io) if you need to debug your JWTs. ### JWT Header JWT header has to contain the following fields: | Field | Field value | |:------|:------------| | alg | HS256 | | typ | JWT | ### JWT Payload Payload for JWT is a JSON object with different fields for each endpoint. You can find the required fields in the specific endpoint documentation. ### JWT Signature JWT has to be signed with the **signatureKey** that you will find in **ControlCenter**. In the case JWT signature is not provided or is invalid, the API will return a `401 Unauthorized error`. ### JWT Example ```json // JWT Header {{ "alg": "HS256", "typ": "JWT" }} // JWT Body {{ "shopId": "65151", "priceAmount": "10.00", "priceCurrency": "USD", "successUrl": "https://merchant.com/success", "declineUrl": "https://merchant.com/decline", "postbackUrl": "https://merchant.com/postback", "email": "shoper@example.com" }} // JWT Signature - your signatureKey from ControlCenter // The final JWT will look like this: eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJzaG9wSWQiOiI2NTE1MSIsInByaWNlQW1vdW50IjoiMTAuMDAiLCJwc mljZUN1cnJlbmN5IjoiVVNEIiwic3VjY2Vzc1VybCI6Imh0dHBzOi8vbWVyY2hhbnQuY29tL3N1Y2Nlc3MiLCJkZWNsaW5l VXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9tZXJjaGFudC5jb20vZGVjbGluZSIsInBvc3RiYWNrVXJsIjoiaHR0cHM6Ly9tZXJjaGFudC5jb2 0vcG9zdGJhY2siLCJlbWFpbCI6InNob3BlckBleGFtcGxlLmNvbSJ9.J8LY9lYSI9HWAiZPjXKLZ7dXIMno9CBIRt5fk9M5gOM ```

tags.name: Purchase
tags.description: API that allows you to integrate a single secure payment for your website.

tags.name: Subscription
tags.description: API that allows you to integrate subscription payments for your website.

tags.name: Postbacks
tags.description:
This part of documentation outlines the event types that occur during the payment process and the mechanism for receiving notifications via postbacks. ### Postback URL Configuration When invoking the `purchase/start` or `subscription/start` endpoints, you are required to provide a `postbackUrl`. This URL will be used to send notifications of relevant events. ### Postback Format The postback will be sent as a JWT (JSON Web Token) token, which will be signed using your provided signature key. Upon receiving the postback, your system must respond with an HTTP status code of 200 OK in 30 seconds. ### Retry Policy In the event that your system does not respond with a 200 OK status code, the API will automatically retry sending the postback up to three (3) times. ### Postback Content The JWT token included in the postback will contain a field named postbackType. This field indicates the type of event that has occurred. Refer to the sections below for detailed information on the data structure for each event type that may be sent via postback. ## Purchase approved Postback sent when a purchase is successfully completed by a buyer.
We will automatically refund the payment if the postback is not received (if your system does not respond with 200 OK HTTP status) after all retries. | Field | Field type | Note | |:--------------|:-----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------| | postbackType | string | `approved` | | orderType | string | `purchase` | | saleId | number or string | | | transactionId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | priceAmount | string | In format `NNN.NN` | | priceCurrency | string | One of: USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, NOK, SEK | | referenceId | string or null | Optional | ## Purchase refund Both chargeback and credit postbacks represent refund transactions of purchase. They differ in terms of the initiator of the refund. | Field | Field type | Note | |:--------------|:-----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------| | postbackType | string | `chargeback` , `credit` | | orderType | string | `purchase` | | saleId | number or string | | | transactionId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | parentId | number or string | Id of transaction that is being refunded | | priceAmount | string | In format `NNN.NN` | | priceCurrency | string | One of: USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, NOK, SEK | | referenceId | string or null | Optional | ## Subscription approved Postback sent when a subscription is successfully completed by a buyer.
We will automatically refund the payment if the postback is not received (if your system does not respond with 200 OK HTTP status) after all retries. | Field | Field type | Note | |:------------------|:-----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------| | postbackType | string | `approved` | | orderType | string | `subscription` | | saleId | number or string | | | transactionId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | priceAmount | string | In format `NNN.NN` | | priceCurrency | string | One of: USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, NOK, SEK | | subscriptionType | string | `recurring` , `one-time` | | subscriptionPhase | string | `normal` , `trial` | | nextChargeOn | string or null | Optional. In format `YYYY-MM-DD`. Present for recurring subscriptionType | | expiresOn | string or null | Optional. In format `YYYY-MM-DD`. Present for one-time subscriptionType. | | referenceId | string or null | Optional | ## Subscription refund Both chargeback and credit postbacks represent refund transactions of subscription. They differ in terms of the initiator of the refund. | Field | Field type | Note | |:------------------|:-----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------| | postbackType | string | `chargeback` , `credit` | | orderType | string | `subscription` | | saleId | number or string | | | transactionId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | parentId | number or string | Id of transaction that is being refunded | | priceAmount | string | In format `NNN.NN` | | priceCurrency | string | One of: USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, NOK, SEK | | subscriptionType | string | `recurring` , `one-time` | | subscriptionPhase | string | `terminated` | | referenceId | string or null | Optional | ## Subscription rebill Postback sent when each recurring subscription payment is successfully processed. For example, if a subscription period is set do `P1M`, a rebill postback will be sent each month. | Field | Field type | Note | |:------------------|:-----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------| | postbackType | string | `rebill` | | orderType | string | `subscription` | | saleId | number or string | | | transactionId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | priceAmount | string | In format `NNN.NN` | | priceCurrency | string | One of: USD, EUR, GBP, AUD, CAD, CHF, DKK, NOK, SEK | | subscriptionType | string | `recurring` | | subscriptionPhase | string | `normal` | | nextChargeOn | string | In format `YYYY-MM-DD`. | | referenceId | string or null | Optional | ## Subscription expiration This postback will be sent, after the last subscription payment. | Field | Field type | Note | |:-----------------|:-----------------|:----------------------------| | postbackType | string | `expiry` | | orderType | string | `subscription` | | saleId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | subscriptionType | string | `recurring` , `one-time` | | referenceId | string or null | Optional | ## Subscription cancel This postback will be sent, after the subscription is cancelled. | Field | Field type | Note | |:------------------|:-----------------|:-------------------------------------------| | postbackType | string | `cancel` | | orderType | string | `subscription` | | saleId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | subscriptionType | string | `recurring` | | subscriptionPhase | string | `normal` , `trial` | | cancelledBy | string | `user` , `support` , `merchant` , `system` | | expiresOn | string or null | Optional. In format `YYYY-MM-DD`. | | referenceId | string or null | Optional | ## Subscription uncancel This postback will be sent, after the subscription is uncancelled. | Field | Field type | Note | |:------------------|:-----------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------| | postbackType | string | `uncancel` | | orderType | string | `subscription` | | saleId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | subscriptionType | string | `recurring` | | subscriptionPhase | string | `normal` , `trial` | | uncancelledBy | string | `support` | | nextChargeOn | string or null | Optional. In format `YYYY-MM-DD`. Present if subscription is still active. | | referenceId | string or null | Optional | ## Subscription extended Postback sent when subscription is extended. | Field | Field type | Note | |:------------------|:-----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------| | postbackType | string | `extend` | | orderType | string | `subscription` | | saleId | number or string | | | shopId | number or string | Shop ID from ControlCenter. | | subscriptionType | string | `recurring` , `one-time` | | subscriptionPhase | string | `normal` , `trial` | | nextChargeOn | string or null | Optional. In format `YYYY-MM-DD`. Present for recurring subscriptionType | | expiresOn | string or null | Optional. In format `YYYY-MM-DD`. Present for one-time subscriptionType. | | referenceId | string or null | Optional |
